bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Tecla Boffil viuda de Dominguez, July 16, 1942

div1.p: Hench writes to Dominguez that he is sorry to hear of her husband's death, and hopes that Dominguez' manuscript on Finlay will be published in English.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Tecla Boffil viuda de Dominguez, July 16, 1942
div1.opener:
July 16, 1942
Sra. Tecla Boffil Vda. de Dominguez
Gutierrez y Mendoza
Marianao, Havana
Cuba
My dear Senora Dominguez:
div1.p:
I am so very sorry to hear from Mr. Peter W.
Suarez that Dr. Dominguez passed away this April. I had
great pleasure in meeting him in Havana last year and the
year before and with his permission the Williams and Wilkins
Co. loaned me his manuscript which I have studied at great
length. I am delighted to hear from Mr. Suarez that some
arrangements may be made for the publication of Dr. Domin-
guez' book in English.

Perhaps at some future visit to Havana, I may
have the privilege of calling you and paying my sincere
respects.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
